Caption: Dr. A.L. Mudaliar declares the convocation open
Description: Sir A. Lakshmanaswami  Mudaliar (1887-1974) was a multi-faceted personality; Doctor, educationist and a renowned statesman. He made a number of significant contributions to society in each of these fields. He was the longest serving Vice-Chancellor of Madras University (27 years) and the first Indian Principal of the Madras Medical College. He was Knighted in the 1945 New Year Honours and awarded both, the Padma Bhushan (1954) and the Padma Vibhushan (1963). He also served as the Chairman of the Board of Governors for IIT, Madras from 1959 to 1969.  . Sir A. L. Mudaliar presided over the third convocation ceremony that was held on the 30th of July 1966 at the Institute's Open Air Theater. On the dais, from the left; Dr. G. Stahl, Mr. T.R. Doss, Mr. T. Muthian (Director of Technical Education, Madras), Prof. S. Rajaraman, Prof. B. Sengupto, Sir C.V. Raman, and Dr. K.S.G. Doss.
